translation.text: Like we're sinking, like we're melting
On a night when the sky just for us spreads out
It was just farewell
I understood everything through that word
The sky with the sun sinking and your figure
overlapped beyond the fence
Since the day we first met
you stole all of my heart
Clad in a somewhat fleeting air
you had lonely eyes
In this world always ticking
tick-tock over and over
tears feel like they're gonna spill over
from the nagging voices and thoughtless words we touch on
but I'm sure together
we can find an ordinary joy
You can't smile in the noisy days
so here's a tomorrow as bright as I can think of for you
Before you fall into a dawnless night,
grab my hands, hey
Even the days you've shut up because you want to forget
will melt with the warmth of embracing
It's not frightening. Until someday when the sun rises,
let's be together
I hate the you who gazes
at something only you can see
Like you're captivated, like you're falling in love
I hate that face
Things you want to believe in, but can't
I'm sure from here on many things like that
will happen no matter what
and each time we'll get angry and cry
But I'm sure someday, I'm sure we will certainly
be able to understand each other. I believe it
I've had enough. I'm worn-out
You shake off my hand I hold out to you so frantically
I've had enough. I'm worn-out
n reality, I wanna say that too
Hey, in the world ticking
tick-tock over and over

I wanna end it

you smiled for the first time

but you reflecting in my eyes are beautiful
the tears overflowing in the dawnless nights
will melt in your smiles

so you gently invite me towards the end
Like sinking, like melting
The mist dyed in deeply clears away
In the days I've shut up because I want to forget
I'll take your hands you hold out for me

Don't let go of our connected hands
